dialog0.title: Instructions
dialog0.text: Your job is to ‘catch’ objects as they fall down the screen. If you hit the right box at the right time, the object will disappear, but if you hit the wrong box or miss it, it will pass right through. Try your best to catch as many objects as possible, but also try to be accurate! Try to only make one response per object. Button mashing is generally frowned upon, and will not lead to success!

dialog1.title: Ready
dialog1.text: Ready to play? Hit "Continue" when you’re ready to go.

dialog2.title: Break
dialog2.text: Great job! You’ve earned yourself a break. Please take a moment to rest your eyes and hands. Hit "Continue" when you’re ready to continue.

dialog3.title: RecogIntro
dialog3.text:
You did great! Did you notice anything in particular about the experiment?

Maybe any patterns or *repetitions*?

Whether you picked up on it or not, a sequence of cues was repeating over and over during the task. It wasn’t there the whole time, but for the majority of the time there was a specific repeating sequence. Now, we’d like to know if you can identify that sequence.

We’re going to have you play through a few short sequences, and after each one, we ask that you rate much you think it was your repeating sequence. Hit “Continue” when you’re ready to go!

dialog4.title: RecogStart
dialog4.text:
Is this your sequence? 
 Hit Continue to Play!

dialog5.title: Rating
dialog5.text: Please rate how much you believe that was your training sequence:
